website_summaries.verdict: This is the ultimate tool for people in engineering and computer science fields. An overall amazing calculator.
pros: We love the notes function, which gives you plenty of space to add your thoughts
Transfer your workings easily from calculator to computer
Bright full-color display with great resolution
cons: Some customers find the buttons awkward to use

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator. Crappy company
customer_reviews.text: Great calculator. Crappy company. Display failed before the 1 year warranty was up. TI says it's physically damaged (dropped, excessive pressure, got wet, etc) and therefore is not covered. Calculator was well cared for, never dropped, got wet wet, etc... Owned many TI products going back to the Speak & Spell including multiple TI calculators (TI 84 Plus CE, TI CX, TI 36X...)... always very reliable. This is the first time actually trying to use the warranty. Seems like their customer service has been engineered by their finest team of accountants. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: allabout

customer_reviews.title: It's a calculator that wants to be a smartphone.
customer_reviews.text: IDK what schools are using the software it comes with but it really is nothing to write home about. I'd say go with a 89 because. A. The 89 is boring and straight forward. B. Calculators don't need trackpads C. button layout is horrible. The only pro is the battery is recharablable. Personally think if you want to study engineering/science/heavy mathmatics you should know how to be prepared and keep a spare set of batteries on hand and not rely on some dumb integrated Li-ion battery.
customer_reviews.author: Boxogoods

customer_reviews.title: Great for double-checking work, but don't get this for a math student as it may be forbidden for classroom use
customer_reviews.text: I love this calculator, but I use it as my BACKUP calculator for studying. If you are studying Algebra or Calculus, I suggest you get a non-CAS calculator for your homework and for use during quizzes and tests, but if you want a fuller understanding of the material, use the CX CAS for additional study in your subjects. My main calculator for doing homework is my TI 84 Plus CE graphing calculator, but there are other good choices. Using it forces you to learn the material better. The CX CAS model allows you to cheat, which is why I recommend you only use it for double-checking your work after you do it.
customer_reviews.author: JohnAroundTheCornerReviews

customer_reviews.title: You will recognize the power of the CX CAS as you advance in math and science
customer_reviews.text: My overwhelming preference is Wolfram's Mathematica, but this is not an option for AP preparation. My daughter prefers the TI 89 over the CX CAS, but she will soon recognize the power of the CX CAS as she grows to understand its power. The calculator has a built-in tutorial that is well done, and TI site has links on on-line interactive instructional material. The user manual is about 500 pages long, but once you "get" the calculator's logic, you don't need it. As soon as you get the calculator, update the operating system in order parallel the online tutorials, but before you so that, down-load the free TI Spire Computer Link to your computer to ease the update process.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bagley

customer_reviews.title: If your not and an Engineering or Physic major get something else.
customer_reviews.text: An amazing calculator for those that can use it and need its powerful abilities. Simply put, if you need it it is the only calculator that can do it. One of the only calculators that can handle imaginary numbers and variables in a matrix. If you are not going to be dealing with imaginary numbers or going into Physics or Engineering then you are better off with something else. My recommendation is the Casio FX-9750GII Pros: can handle any calculations you need to do makes you look and feel important Cons: difficult to use cost
customer_reviews.author: jeshua

customer_reviews.title: Excellent calculator, better value than the aging TI-89
customer_reviews.text: I think this will become the new standard before too long. I'm glad that it doesn't cost much more than the TI-89 and the screen is an enormous improvement. Tons of built in libraries of variables, etc. Rechargeable battery is a huge plus, and lasts a long time. For a long time the gigantic shortcoming of TI graphing calculators was the stone-age low screen resolution. This device is finally somewhat current in that department and it really shows when you get some complex graphs plotted on the screen. Having colors to distinguish different graphs on the same page is a huge plus as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Z

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: If you are studying electrical or mechanical engineering, this is the calculator for you. If any of your courses will allow you to use this calculator on exams, this calculator is a must. It will save you an immense amount of time over doing many operations by hand. Will expand partial fractions, integrate, doing all manners of matrix operations (including matrices with complex numbers), and much more. Computes almost everything almost instantaneously. Allows you to type in many operations as you would write them instead of function calls -- integrals, summations, division, etc. Allows you to quickly store values or equations to symbols to reduce data entry. The list goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice calculator but dumb marketing
customer_reviews.text: Outside of being annoyed that my TI-Nspire CX basically told me to get this in order to do some of the operations I wanted to this product seems very good. For those interested in doing indefinate integrals and a few other things you will need this CAS version instead of the standard CX version. Primary reason for 4 stars is that the calculator I had was like go buy this other one or suck it up and do something else. (i believe indefinited are represented by+or- 1x10^999 in the CX standard).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator in the business
customer_reviews.text: Best calculator in the business, especially love the software that comes with it. It's only licensed for one computer though so pick choose it wisely because when you update your PC you lose it. That last part is pretty lame actually.... Another issue is the lack of a touch screen, but i believe this was done to meet test standards, otherwise the calculator may be banned from academia (which certain instructors may due anyway due to the CAS part.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Control

customer_reviews.title: Good product - Toxic Application Developer Community
customer_reviews.text: The calculator is a force to be reckoned with; however, be aware that the application community is a bit of a black market underground, selling incredibly over priced applications to desperate students and professionals. Honestly, if you are going to get this thing, consider if you really need it. I am a graduate business student and I love being able to save my calculations as documents for later to reference. I just wish the community wasnt out there trying to make a quick buck off of everyone with their 5 minute applications.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Six weeks old and won't charge
customer_reviews.text: My son has had this for six weeks and now the battery won't charge. Plugging in the charger the unit turns on, starts loading then turns off. Seems because the battery is low the operating system can't start to charge the battery. What a great design! Now, reading the one-star reviews this seems to be a common problem. The only thing that saves this from being a one star is that TI is shipping me a new (charged) battery so that I can upgrade the OS and hopefully resolve the problem. My advice is to look for a different model.
customer_reviews.author: crazyteach

customer_reviews.title: worked only 2 1/2 months than unoperable
customer_reviews.text: My son ordered this for his advanced high school math class and it lasted only 2 months before it would not turn on. The calculator is constantly on the loading screen and does not get into an operational mode. We need a replacement but are concerned about replacing it with the same type and the return date ended a month after purchase. This calculator lasted less than 2 1/2 months. This is unacceptable and I would like to send it back and receive a replacement if possible. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: concerned parent

customer_reviews.title: Alien Level Hardware
customer_reviews.text: Imagine sitting in class trying to figure out that complicated equation on a Ti-83 only to look over and notice BAM!! The person next to you pulls out this piece of space age, next generation equipment. Seriously this thing is the best calculator I have ever used after you learn the various functions. No longer will you need to do multiple equations to arrive at a solution. With this bad boy you just key in the variable you want to solve for and BLAMO!! You blow the hair off the person sitting next to you because you were able to solve the problem that took them 10 minutes in approximately 10 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Turbo11

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ !
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is a MUST have if you ever do any physics, advanced math, or engineering. I haven't found a calculation it can't do. Complete the square, factor, solve, quadratic equation, indefinite and definite integrals, double and single derivatives, etc... Seriously, everything else just wastes your time. Be sure to check with your teacher however, if you're taking Calc I or II they might not let you have it in tests coz it's too smart !
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: This will make you the envy of your upper level math peers
customer_reviews.text: It will also make you forget your integration algorithms because it will solve the majority of integrals, derivatives, and summation problems. It has some really nice number theory functions like mod, gcm, lcm, and lots of stats functions. My only beef is the fact that it won't graph multivariable functions/surfaces. I mean it's 2019, my phone can run geogebra. For this price it would be nice to at least be able to graph surfaces in low resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The King of Calculators.
customer_reviews.text: I am a computer science major. This field of study requires an immense amount of mathematics. I bought this calculator when I started an advanced algebra course. The calculator carried me through that course, through two semesters of pre-calculus, and now in my first semester of calculus. I love this thing soooo much. It really is a tool that I cannot live without! There isn't much mathematically that you can't do with this thing. And compared to a ti-84, or 89, the information is presented to you in such a beautiful way. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you want the best grade possible
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money! This calculator can do a whole lot that other calculators can't and its interface is very intuitive. This baby has carried me through calculus and I received straight A's all the way there! This can even give exact answers to integrals! Just check RateMyProfessor before enrolling in classes to make sure this calculator is ok to use in that class.
customer_reviews.author: SullyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Better read the instructions, register with TI for the learning tasks, and watch plenty of YouTubes before you should expect to become proficient with this. There should be a college course for this product, worth three credits! OK, I exaggerate, but there is a learning curve. I bought one for myself and one for my son. I wasn't allowed to use this in class or exams, but my son was able to get an A after at first thinking he was going to fail calculus. Maybe I should take a class with his professor...
customer_reviews.author: ren

customer_reviews.title: Awesome graphing calculator with CAS capability.
customer_reviews.text: This one is the best of the best in my opinion. The Nspire is a proven platform, and I've yet to see it choke on a calculation. The CAS functions on this model are great. My only complaint would be the two separate versions (CX or CX CAS) instead of the approach HP took offering the ability to simply turn off the CAS function for a classroom test environment.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: READ!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator does indefinite integrals and factors stuff. Odds are you are a incoming college who's probably taking calculus or some other imposible math class, and you want a calculator that can get shift done. Imjust gonna throw it out there cause I know half of you are looking for the same thing I was looking for. You can literally type notes and equations and example problems into this thing, so if you've got a low c, sitting in class with 1HP and a dream, then consider this calculator your new Jesus.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Very short learning curve to a huge time saver!
customer_reviews.text: This calculator can do everything! As a computer engineering major is has been a lifesaver. I came from a Ti-83 plus and wish I would have done this much sooner. I've mostly been using it for imaginary number calculations and sinusoids so I cant say much about the graphing portion but having this quality and size of a screen to copy and paste large equations multiple times has shaved off a ton of time. Also, viewing a fraction the way you would write it is not to be understated, so much clearer than a mess of parenthesis and slashes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to be doing a significant amount of math just buy this. It will save you so much time it's ridiculous. That being said if your learning new material be careful how you use it, it can solve a lot of things in one step and if you always rely on it you could easily forget the steps for how to do something. Even if you're not doing advance math this is still with it. The algebra solver and formating for division alone make this well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt have got through calc without it
customer_reviews.text: In many of my classes they dont let us use calculators but in some they do and in those cases having one of these instead of your standard ti-82 or whatever is definitely a big advantage. The other calculators might be able to do integrals and matrices and such but I could never figure out how and it was such a hastle it wasnt worth to even try and bother with it during a test. This calculators interface is much more user friendly. I would definitely reccomend it for college especially if you are taking lots of math/physics/engineering classes.
customer_reviews.author: T4keTheShot

customer_reviews.title: Screen not properly connected(glued), buttons awkward... skip this one.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son, he is taking some college level math and engineering classes, he was excited to receive it. The problem is the screen is not properly attached to the case of the calculator and had a 1/8' gap. The tough screen protector had to be cut to accommodate the power button. and overall the buttons were hard to press and made for awkward not intuitive calculations. He asked me to returned in and is using his 15 year old TI-89.
customer_reviews.author: mama Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Awesomely Powerful Integration Machine
customer_reviews.text: One complaint: it doesn't have direct support for vector calculus. However I do understand that's a bit ridiculous to expect out of a CAS, as I'm using it primarily for electromagnetism and circuit analysis. It's incredibly powerful, chugs out triple integrals and infinite summations with ease, I've never had any calculation take longer than it took my finger to leave the button. The keyboard is somewhat awkward as they have decided against a standard QWERTY layout, and the touchpad-ish takes some getting used to, but this is an incredibly powerful and useful calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan E.

customer_reviews.title: Graphing Calculator
customer_reviews.text: problem I had is it came in all ready opened but was supposed to be new. the Calculator was at the bottom of the box with the charger and the packaging laid on top so it seems to have been packaged already opened and separated. But didn't look used, he needed it right away for school so sending it back wasn't a good option. But it has worked okay
customer_reviews.author: nerak01

customer_reviews.title: Caution: Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: I've literally had the same Ti-83 for almost 20 years. It has served me well. Through undergrad Chem major to chem teacher to business school. But I'm in grad school for economics now, and I had a excuse to upgrade. I was excited to get it, but there is a definite learning curve - so much that for the first couple of weeks of the math class I'm taking, I went with the old calculator. I just know it better. Playing around with it helps, and it is a very powerful tool. It's just takes some time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edgar Mihelic, MA, MBA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing device
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have ever made since going back to college. If you have to do any math at a college level, buy this calculator and check out all the tutorials on how to use it on youtube. This calculator pays for itself in all the time and frustration you'll save in your academic journey. The other TI calculators don't hold a candle to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dvice

customer_reviews.title: ... doesn't have the words to describe how much I love this calculator
customer_reviews.text: The English language doesn't have the words to describe how much I love this calculator. I study Mechanical/Aerospace Engineering so it should go without saying that there are plenty of chances every day to put this thing to the test. Besides being a method of checking work, it does all of the tedious calculations we all remember from Calc 2/3 (nothing like having to do integration by parts on some convoluted equation), Linear Algebra (anyone else find it time-consuming to perform Gauss-Jordan reduction on a 5x5 matrix by hand?), and Differential Equations (series solutions, anyone?) so as to leave plenty of time for analyzing the solution within the context of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Math Dude

customer_reviews.title: How is this allowed on the SAT?
customer_reviews.text: This calculator will do everything you need and then some. If you are a student in a non-calculus class it will save you time and double-check your answers. The computer algebra system (CAS) works well and enables you to simply write in an equation and get the answer you need. You will not need a better calculator than the Nspire CAS. It is relatively straightforward and easy to learn but enables a world of possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Cover Has Been Damaged When Item Arrived
customer_reviews.text: bought 2, one of them is ok. the other one, upon arrival, the plastic cover has been damaged. I suspect someone dropped the calculator on the ground and thus damaged the plastic cover. I have to return this item. You should check the cover carefully after it arrives. I will update this review after the new replacement comes. update: the new one arrived, with cracked plastic cover too!!!!! seems like someone dropped it!
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Cannot activate license, device not recognized
customer_reviews.text: Cannot activate software license for the CAS Student Software: "Cannot find a Ti-NSPIRE handheld. Please ensure that your Ti-Nspire handheld has the Ti-Nspire keypad installed, is securely connected, is turned on, and not in use. Then try again" The handheld IS recognized though and can even transfer an OS update to it. I would stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: D@rkFX

customer_reviews.title: it was always a headache because of poor graph quality when I had to use my Ti-89
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have to say it was a huge upgrade from TI-89 to CX CAS. When working with integrals in calculus, it was always a headache because of poor graph quality when I had to use my Ti-89. Another thing that was cool with the TI-Nspire is the great templates that made using the calculator very easy to use. One thing that I do miss is the ans(x) function which would allow me to go back in history to gather an answer. But overall, the TI-Nspire is very easy to use and I highly recommend it to math geeks that don't have to take anymore math in college(classes usually don't allow a calculator this powerful).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Williams

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter adores this calculator. She was using the TI-84 Plus; we upgraded her to the Nspire CX CAS for her PreCal class, and she is so happy with this new calculator. She won't be able to use this on the ACT, so she will take the TI-84Plus for that (she's okay with that because it's a good calculator), but she really loves the Nspire for everyday use, plus she'll be able to continue using the Nspire for Calculus and into college. It was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Warm Hearth

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CALCULATOR!!
customer_reviews.text: This is AMAZING!! The possibilities are endless(almost). The Nspire CX CAS is quite a bit different than my TI84, in so many good ways. Although the software is taking a little getting use to I am completely satisfied with my new graphing calculator. I am a mechanical engineering major this is great for anyone going into physics, engineering or math majors. I have also noticed it could be helpful for accounting/statistic/finance major and maybe many more. The different formulas create so many possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Scotsman83

customer_reviews.title: Amazing calculator to use during exams
customer_reviews.text: I was too lazy to remember any formulas for my Circuits-II exam, so I just wrote them down into the notes. It makes taking complex/imaginary problems from a time consuming mess to something that can be done fast. It can also take derivates, integrals, limits, etc. and solve them for you. That feature alone saved my grade during my final for when I forgot how to take limits that produce an indeterminate answer.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: The best calculator you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: I am an Electrical Engineer, and I used this calculator in my undergraduate and graduate studies and still using it in my daily work. This is an amazing product. The best part of it is the screen and ease of use. I highly recommend this product to all engineering students.
customer_reviews.author: sasoun

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent calculator. For every math-based engineering course I've taken ...
customer_reviews.text: Capability-wise, this is an excellent calculator. For every math-based engineering course I've taken (electrical engineering), it's covered me well. My only complaint is the UI, it's very clunky and often hard to navigate. This isn't helped by the touchpad/directional buttons, which aren't individual and are combined into a big pad. Other than that, great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Must have for grad school
customer_reviews.text: I seriously love this thing. As an engineering grad student I do a lot of work with matrices and this calculator is a boss at matrix manipulation. I also love how you can enter formulas in a format that resembles how you would actually write them. No more guessing if I put the parenthesis in the right place somewhere off screen.
customer_reviews.author: Jill W.

customer_reviews.title: A must-buy for returning college students
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this calculator to help me survive college chemistry after entering college ten years after I graduated high school. It is nothing short of amazing and the computational algebra system (CAS) has allowed me to focus on my chemistry while it works through the algebra that I have, quite frankly, forgotten over the last decade. This calculator can take a 5 part equation and, using the SOLVE function, rearrange the equation for any variable you need. In chemistry this is a godsend, and I don't think I could survive the class without it. I would recommend this model calculator over every other for that feature alone.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Best Calculator Ever
customer_reviews.text: Awesome calculator. 3D graphing capabilities, the CAS allows simple algebra calculations... Stored equations make difference calculations simple(f1(3)-f1(1))/(3-1), great for checking answers after solving them (like making sure algebra, limits, derivatives,et cetera were done correctly)... Can get applications like 2048 and a Gameboy emulator for waiting after a test... beautiful design. Would recommend to anyone in higher collegiate math or a math-heavy career (like physics, my dream field). If you aren't going into at least Calc 2, I wouldn't recommend it as it's more calculator than necessary for that level, a TI-84+ Silver would be better. But to anyone in high maths, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper Scelsi

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it for Engineering students
customer_reviews.text: This is a great calculator at a competitive/fair price. While this CAS version cannot be used for core curriculum (math/science/physics/etc.) classes in college, it is allowed (at many colleges) and invaluable for upper-level classes related to engineering tracks. While it's user interface does take a little getting used to, compared to the older/more traditional TI calculators, it is incredibly powerful and efficient ones the operator becomes familiar with it.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn to use
customer_reviews.text: This is one of four types purchased for college use in two years. This one was suggested by a physics 2 professor, and it has been the easiest to learn to use. Its use has been carried over into Calculus 3 and Statics/Dynamics classes as well. Definitely reliable. Wish this had been the first “required” and only purchase made in the calculators needed for college.
customer_reviews.author: Seacgrav

customer_reviews.title: Good third party seller
customer_reviews.text: I came on here looking for a calculator to buy for a summer prep class. I didn’t need a brand new calculator for full price, just a good one with the CAS function. Ended up buying it from Alltex— a third party seller listed the calculator for $120. To those who just need a usable calculator, I recommend taking some time to try and find a better deal. Bump against a good seller—like the seller I bumped into—you just might find yourself smiling in the end because you found such a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bookreds

customer_reviews.title: Great for engineering
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing calculator. It is helping me through my engineering classes. A little high on the learning curve, must research how to operate this in the functions you need. Example, matrixes or solving multiple linear equations. Also great for engineering students who need to practice their units. Can just type in the unit in your equations and it will cancel what you do not need or multiply them together. Like I would do this for example: (5*m/s^2) * 10*k where I would be short for kg. Then equal and it will give me 50km/s^2 all together meaning this is a N for Neuton. So 50N
customer_reviews.author: Brian N.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price but is very useful
customer_reviews.text: I like a lot about this calculator it's easy to use, but you may have to mess with it a bit to get use to it. But the only thing is the price this is technically way outdated technology and they are charging $160 for it so I don't think that really makes any since but besides that it's great but I cant recommend the purchase because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Joyner

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I'm an engineering student in university. No professor has told me that I couldn't use it and it works great. One thing that is pretty neat is that you can punch in algebraic equations and it can solve for x or y without issues if your having issues with algebra or just looking to save a little time when taking a math/ engineering exam.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Best calc ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best calculator ever! I'm taking PSE1 and Calc2 this semester and wish I had purchased this calculator way in algebra class. It runs on some of the same simple commands that 'C' does, which makes it easy to remember all the little tricks too. The software comes in very handy when needing to program a bunch of notes or make several graphs. You can even save images to this for viewing, I keep the unit circle on mine with some harder trig identities.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted this calculator for months and was finally able to get it. It works BEAUTIFULLY. It's fast and has tons of awesome features, not the least of which is the CAS. However, for those of you who, like me, will be upgrading from a TI-83 or similar, it does take some getting used to. Many of the functions are embedded into menus within the scratchpad (where you do the calculations), so in that respect it's a bit harder to use than the older TI models. If you don't want to learn a new calculator but still want the better color screen, look at the TI-84 Plus CE or TI-84 Plus C Silver Edition.
customer_reviews.author: R. Swarts

customer_reviews.title: This calculator is awesome. I'm a college student
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is awesome. I'm a college student, I use it mainly for finite math/statistics, and it's amazing. I love the functions. When I first got it it was set to some sort of rounding mode, so if you want precise answers, just change the settings to "fix 8" (meaning the number of decimal places it goes out to is 8) or some other fixed setting. There are lots of shortcuts to use which makes solving problems way faster than if I had a TI-83/84. The price is great, the product is great. If you need a graphing calculator, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: sarah demeo

customer_reviews.title: Math Nerd Approved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is pursuing an electrical engineering degree (after finishing his physics degree -- madness!) He really loves it, and asked for a hard case for it so he doesn't break his new baby. I think his favorite part is being able to put in ridiculously long equations without using the millions of parenthesis he had to do on the TI-89. Math nerd approved.
customer_reviews.author: Kimpropriety

customer_reviews.title: really cool but bit of a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: this thing makes you feel like you're in the future. has all the bells and whistles. This thing could send a rocket to the moon. it does require a bit of playing around with though. The menu is more like a computer, so if you're used to a ti-83 or something similar you might have to break out the manual for a bit. would still recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: The greatest graphing calculator ever
customer_reviews.text: I could talk about all the bells and whistles of this calculator. It is just the greatest calculator ever. Don't waste money on the ti-83,84,89,....etc. For the price, this is your best bet. The application you can download and buy are beyond amazing. I went through college chemistry, biochemistry, physics, trigonometry, and calculus. Never earned lower than an A- thanks to this little beast.
customer_reviews.author: Sherpani

customer_reviews.title: It has been awesome and has a test mode for using on standardized ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has used this calculator all through high school. It has been awesome and has a test mode for using on standardized tests. It has served her well and will continue to do so at Honors College and Engineering school. Recommended for those highly involved with an emphasis in science and math.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Don's hesitate if you're comparing to other brands....
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best full color, CAS calculator. I have the other brand flagship calculator and this is far superior in many ways. It also comes with a free copy of the Windows emulator which adds to the value of the purchase. Combine that with a huge community and the ability to run Ti-8x programs, this is a perfect, modern solution.
customer_reviews.author: Domenic

customer_reviews.title: Electrical Engineering
customer_reviews.text: If you are an Electrical Engineering student this is a must. It does derivatives, integrals, roots, converts polar to rectangular, and so much more with ease. One of my top five investments at college. If they offer you the tools....use them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Heath

customer_reviews.title: It has awesome color and graphing features
customer_reviews.text: I used this calculator for some of my calculus courses in college and it was my life saver. It has awesome color and graphing features, it was simple to use. This calculator has great battery potential, I almost went a whole quarter without charging it. This calculator has been passed down to my siblings and it is perfectly intact, functions well. I also got a lot of compliments from classmates for the sleek look and design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super happy wth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: This things is amazing. As an engineering major, moving onto aerospace engineering for grad school, a lot of formulas are incredibly long, and calculators typically do a poor job showing you whether you typed it in correctly. This calculator is great because it will show you what you typed in in normal written format. There is also some custom firmware that you can install called Ndless that will give you access to a lot more capabilities that don't come naturally on the device. My recommendation: don't let this device do the thinking for you. Use it is a checking tool, because it is easy to rely on its abilities to do the thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator with lots of capabilities
customer_reviews.text: This calculator does everything, except the laundry. The screen is amazing and unlike any calculator I've ever used, the internal battery is rechargeable and lasts several days before needing to be recharged. The touchpad on this calculator is a bit different and takes some getting used to. Another odd thing about this calculator is how strange the keyboard is, it's in alphabetical order and not QWERTY making writing notes a little difficult. I'm still learning more about this device and will update as my review in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Turned on enough to set it up then never turned ...
customer_reviews.text: Turned on enough to set it up then never turned on again. Bought $20 battery replacement and still didnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I love how you do not have to input a billion ...
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is REALLY user friendly once you figure out how to use it. I ended up using a few Youtube videos to give me a tutorial on a few of my statistic class assignments. I love how you do not have to input a billion steps just to solve a problem like the older versions and once you learn the shortcuts, its even better. If you are taking stats or higher, heck, even algebra, buy this, and you will love it. Just be prepared if your school hasn't integrated this calculator into its programs, you will be youtubing the steps.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: CAS = Computer Algebra System. CAS does all the work for me, and I honestly can't believe it's allowed in my calculus class. Absolutely no problems with the battery because I did 5 minutes of research on how to properly treat lithium batteries, unlike the majority of bad reviews on here. Just don't let it sit at 0% charge for a year (AKA User error!) and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: William Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace a ti-86 that had a bad cosine button due to a battery leak
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a ti-86 that had a bad cosine button due to a battery leak. The CAS function more then makes up for the lack of function buttons as the alpha buttons take up the space. And I wish it was a qwerty lay out verses alphabetical, that's the reason for the four stars. I'm using this in Chemistry and calculus and I've barely scratched the surface of what this can do.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Cram

customer_reviews.title: College student recommended.
customer_reviews.text: If you are in school for any technical application this is the calculator to have. It has saved me a TON of time with the user interface where i can go back quickly and edit an equation without needing to type it all back into the calculator. I don't need the CAS all the time but that is a nice feature for homework, but most professors don't allow this for exams at my university. Would buy again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Loyal Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CAS makes it easy
customer_reviews.text: Superb calculator. Using it for Calculus, however it has more advanced options. It does integration and derivatives automatically! I like the ease of use and straight-forward controls. I don't like the auto scroll button or arrow keys. They are too sensitive and often lead to accidental clicks. The battery life lasts many days-worth of constant use, and is re-chargeable. I've suggested this product to my friends, and three have purchased it, all giving rave reviews. Honestly, this calculator is a major factor in getting me through my math and science classes. Would recommend for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent J. Marotta

customer_reviews.title: Everything the TI89 can do and prettier.
customer_reviews.text: Seems really good. Had a TI-89 before. Can do everything my TI-89 could do and more, pretty happy with it, it has alot of features I am still learning to use since I am taking Calculus II currently in the summer. The screen is way better & prettier for viewing graphs and you can literally plug into sum and limit equations on a display (you don't have to use commas etc..)
customer_reviews.author: Al Pizano

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator for college classes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my statistics and chemistry class. This calculator, while it looks complicated, is actually, in my opinion, easier to use than the TI-83 or 84. It does everything I need for my classes. Before buying just make sure this is allowed. I don't think you can use it for the ACT or SAT. I never had a problem with professors not allowing me to use it, but you may want to check with them before making the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Combs

customer_reviews.title: Wrong item.. but it will work
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrong item, but good thing that this will work for my math class.. love the color but I wasn’t expecting it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Glasgo

customer_reviews.title: and it gives you weird decimal approximations of things like 2i (1
customer_reviews.text: This calculator gets the job done. It does everything I need it to, and quite a bit more. The command system can be a little hard to use for certain things, and it gives you weird decimal approximations of things like 2i (1.9999999999i etc..) when you calculate an Eigan vector, but that's ok. the 3D graphing is no maple, but you can do it in the palm of your hand. Buy this calculator before you will need it for whatever math class you will be allowed to use it in, so that you can learn the functionality by the time you're going to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Z. Nephew

customer_reviews.title: Got me an A on the final
customer_reviews.text: Saved my bottom when it gave me a different answer for a few integrals I did. It took me a bit of time to figure out what I was doing wrong (forgot a sign). But otherwise, I would have missed quite a few points for careless mistakes. I got it a few days before the final (with the Professor's permission) to familiarize myself with it. Also brought along my ti 84 just incase ( turned out to be awesome using both at the same time). Getting ready to head into some pretty demanding math courses and I feel more than prepared with the Nspire and the 84 by my side.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wilcoxson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible engineering
customer_reviews.text: The mouse pad (the up-down-right-left arrows) are so difficult to press that I needed to press sometimes 20 times the same arrow key to get the cursor where I wanted it to be. Not only that, it makes a loud click whenever you press any key. Imagine pressing the same arrow key 20 times or more? The perfect tool to annoy everyone around you. I had to return it. I'm using a TI-89 now.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Y. Yuri

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive Touchpad & slower typing speed than previous generation NSpire CAS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product solely for the backlit display and integrated rechargeable battery pack. I noticed that typing numbers and operators is somewhat slower than the previous generation NSpire with the oval-shaped number buttons. And also, this may be a minor annoyance to you but this new calculator's buttons make noticeably more noise too. Finally if your hands tend to get sweaty, the touchpad becomes very unresponsive: this has generally been an issue with the previous-gen NSpire too. Honestly, I would probably purchase the previous generation NSpire. I don't think I need a backlit display since I'm not going to do my mathematics homework in a dark room. Keep in mind of these drawbacks before purchasing this calculator!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful calculator for advanced math courses
customer_reviews.text: Most powerful calculator I've ever had. Solved almost anything, I use this for numeric methods and i believe it is useful for a lot of classes like calculus, algebra and statistics, though I believe it is not permitted because it kind of counts as cheating, so I would recommend it as an instrument for studying. Arrived on time on the original package and the calculator and I do regret the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalye Deras

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: this calculator is amazing! I use this EVERY day as an electronics engineering student. I am the only one that has this particular one, and I complete tests and answers much faster than others. While others are still working on going from degrees to radians or finding their notations, I'm already 5 questions ahead with this bad boy! I did have some issues with the battery level not displaying properly. A quick call to TI and 1 firmware update later, it works like a champ! The TI for dummies book is not really necessary as this thing is pretty user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Mnk89

customer_reviews.title: better than TI-89
customer_reviews.text: The templates for input are what puts this calculator light years beyond the TI-89 series, no momorizing long series of entries. Integrals, derivatives, summation, etc, all have templates that look exactly like you would write with pencil and paper, the user interface is awesome. It takes a little adjustment if you have had a TI-84 or 89 in the past (like me), but once you catch on you realize how user-friendly this calculator really is. With the CAS system, this calculator is extremely powerful, the sky is the limit. I have already learned how to do far more with this calculator in the first few months than I ever did with my TI-89.
customer_reviews.author: ryantlinder6

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator!
customer_reviews.text: Really good calculator! Nice screen and apps build inside plus the apps for pc. If you dont need the color screen and the built in documents program, I will recommend you instead the ti 89 titanium, wich for my point of view, its easier to use than this nspire cx cas. The trackpad its the only stuff I dont really like, but works ok so it depends what youre using it for. Both are amazing calculators, and I will recommend it before any othe brand high calculator.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Graphing Calculator for Student
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent calculator for a student! It has alot of very useful features. Data can be entered for statistical and other analysis via spreadsheets, which makes life considerably easier. The notes and scratchpad features are great for memos and quick calculations. The only disadvantages I could see were: (i) the trackpad could be improved, although it would not prevent me from buying it again if I had to; (ii) the keyboard layout is not QWERTY, which has something to do with exam requirements I think; and (iii) I believe that there may be other restrictions on its use in examination contexts. Make sure to check with your institution before you shell out for this quite expensive calculator.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: An excellent calculator
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent calculator, probably the best on the market right now. It has tons of features, and you can download more online. I'm using it for my engineering courses, and the advanced functions like graphing, computer algebra, calculus, and differential equations are very useful. My unit arrived with the clamshell packaging cracked open above the screen, so I was worried that the screen would be cracked, but the screen was luckily undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Blake R

customer_reviews.title: In a word, AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several Ti calculators before but this one takes the cake. Due to its screen and how it works, it is actually better (for me) than the 89. I have since retired the other calculators and use this exclusively. The provided software is great as well. Only thing that sucks is that you can only have it installed on one computer. If you wanted to have the software installed on your personal PC and on a laptop you haul around campus or any other place you may need it, you can't. Other than that, it was a great buy. Can't wait to see what Ti does next with their next generation of calculators.
customer_reviews.author: Costa

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator = happy birthday
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has wanted this calculator for months. She emailed me the direct link with a "hint, hint!" message. And when her birthday arrived and she opened it, she was one happy camper, "nerding out" as she puts it, as she played with her new calculator. She couldn't wait to use it with a friend who has the same one. As a math lover, she'll likely get one even fancier down the road, especially as she plans to study math in college. But this one is plenty strong for an incoming high-school senior geeking out in AP Calc.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I started with the ti84 plus for my pre calculus and calculus 1 classes. Unfortunately as you keep advancing the ti84 becomes obsolete. Even my calculus textbook recommended the nspire. I use it to verify all my results and it's a great aid for the graphs. Though I still have to learn more than half of the infinite features that this calc offers, I feel the difference of using this task smart calc compared to the ti-84.
customer_reviews.author: Adzplusone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for College
customer_reviews.text: I'm a college business student and this thing has saved my life on several occasions with the CAS (Computer Algebra System). Just make sure you charge it once a month or so and you're good to go with the long battery and clear image. Not to mention the computer software it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: User friendly. Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: This calculator is awesome. Handles my college algebra class with ease. Can do so much more than you think it can. Best $160 I ever spent!!! And I found lots of how to videos on YouTube that were super helpful in getting to know this calculator and all its functions.
customer_reviews.author: AngelEyes

customer_reviews.title: Best calculator I have owned
customer_reviews.text: The reason I love this calculator so much is that there is no special order I have to put equations if I want it solved. For example in the Ti-89 and below models If I wanted to put in solve x^2+3x+1 I would have to separate the parameters such variables and what I want solved by a comma. If something went wrong it was hard to see where I typed something wrong. Not with the Nspire, the way you would write the equation on the paper is exactly how you would enter it in the calculator. This calculator has made Calc based Physics much tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Monish

customer_reviews.title: Great Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: Best calculator ever! This calculator is very user friendly and easy to get use to. After you dump the knowledge of the gawdy OS of the previous TI's you can get to love it. Online, downloadable content makes calculating things like projectile distances and forces very easy. Battery life is good, not great, but the fact that it is rechargeable with the included cable and battery makes the week long battery life sustainable.
customer_reviews.author: Maxximus

customer_reviews.title: For those too lazy to do math
customer_reviews.text: If you learn how to use this calculator you basically don’t even need to do much work! Just find the shortcuts online and it’s potential is unlimited. Beware for a few months my 4 key didn’t click properly, but the problem fixed itself over use
customer_reviews.author: James Matthew Gomez

customer_reviews.title: I think this is great in concept
customer_reviews.text: I think this is great in concept, but I find the trackpad very frustrating to use, and the buttons are LOUD. I can't imagine using this on an in-class test without bothering other students. I like this CAS version better than the plain CX, but it is still very frustrating to use. It's not particularly useful at home, either, as there are better and easier to use computer algebra systems available for laptops. This product occupies an awkward space in-between a calculator and computer and doesn't pull off either particularly well. Stick with the TI-84 Plus CE.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL for graphing
customer_reviews.text: Get this Nspire with CX with CAS, NOT TI-89. TI-89 has horrible graphics, bad software, etc. Nspire is easy to use and does everything you need for graphing. If you just need algebra calculator, get the TI-84. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Value & Durability

customer_reviews.title: I have loved my new Nspire CX CAS calculator
customer_reviews.text: I have loved my new Nspire CX CAS calculator. As an engineering student I use it everyday. The battery lasts a very long time before needing to be charged again. The programs and functions available on the calculator are very helpful and make using it so much easier than other graphing calculators. Get this calculator! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Julie P.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for STEM Majors
customer_reviews.text: Great for doing algebra, calculus, stats, and more. Very helpful in dealing with complex numbers. It even does complex algebra, which is insane. This calculator has saved me on many Engineering exams.
customer_reviews.author: E. Juul

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent calculator, although it does have a bit of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent calculator, although it does have a bit of a learning curve. There is a built in spreadsheet application, and although it is slower to use than a computer it is fairly capable and a nice inclusion. The fit an finish is excellent, and the buttons are more clicky than those of a Ti-84. Battery life has been excellent, and there is a built in guide for those who are having difficulties migrating to this more powerful calculator.
customer_reviews.author: null

customer_reviews.title: Great calculator
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from a TI-84 Silver. So far, I like it. Haven't gotten to use it to its full potential yet. The functions are very helpful with engineering upper level courses. The color screen is a nice touch, as well as the rechargeable battery. This calculator is very comparable to the TI-89 Titanium (I've used both), and both have their strong suits. However, this one with its back lit screen made it much easier for me to read, and for the functions I need (calculus operations, systems, etc), it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great "little CPU"
customer_reviews.text: This Calculator is very powerful and advanced, as it is the newest calculator of the TI company. It does everything a high school student needs it to do (and more). Only thing I have to suggest to be cautious of... DO NOT leave your calculator unsupervised, mine was stole in a matter of seconds and I've never got it back again. And also if you chose to purchase this calculator and you've never used a Nspire product - I would recommend buying the "TI-Nspire For Dummies" instruction book. It explains everything it can do in most specific detail and serves as an exceptional reference guide.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Hulbin

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a very capable device that will last for quite a few years
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure that it's a fine calculator...I just haven't had occasion to use it yet. It powers on and it arrived on time, in unopened packaging, so I have no complaints there. My degree program takes me through Calc II, Linear Algebra, Stats, and Numerical Methods, so I'm sure that this thing will serve me well. It *is* a bit pricey, but 2/3 the price of other places that I've looked (bookstore).
customer_reviews.author: Ray Morgan

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for engineering students.
customer_reviews.text: Buy this if you want to succeed in math but make sure you know how to use it! You can do so many equations with this! Don’t have to worry about solving for X no longer with this puppy! BTW also make sure your professor allows this! I know some professors don’t because of how much it can do for you!
customer_reviews.author: TheGirlTalka

customer_reviews.title: The CAS system is amazing. When doing calculations the CAS system will show ...
customer_reviews.text: The CAS system is amazing. When doing calculations the CAS system will show your answers as if you wrote them out. If pi or a square root is in the answer the CAS system will put it in the answer appropriately. Then you can just change the answer to decimal or fraction or whatever. This is my second Nspire and I still have my first. This calculator does everything I ask of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definition of a Smart Calculator!
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a graphing calculator for college math, so I decided to buy him one that could perform higher math calculations. This calculator factors polynomials, evaluates limits, etc. you can’t go wrong with this!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Preston

customer_reviews.title: My favorite thing about it might be the computer based software ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have purchased this thing sooner. I tried to make due with computer based calculators, spreadsheets and my old TI-89 but this calculator is incredible. My favorite thing about it might be the computer based software that you can download and activate with your purchase. The software really streamlines coding and calculation.
customer_reviews.author: N.S. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: As an engineering student, you're gonna want a good graphing calculator. The usb rechargable battery and backlit screen on this model gives it a plus over the TI83 and TI89 models. The only disadvantages (for me personally) is that the keyboard takes some getting used to as it is not QWERTY but alphabetical and that there are not as many downloadable programs for it yet compared to other earlier models. But it does have a lot of built in functions that are easier to use than earlier models. Well worth spending the extra cash to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: J. Castle

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and required equipment
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for college classes. These are very expensive machines in my opinion but at least near me all of the college level classes require them. I have had to purchase two of these and Amazon price is cheaper if you can't find a used on locally.
customer_reviews.author: TySon

product_meta.title: Texas Instruments Nspire CX CAS Graphing Calculator
product_meta.description: Stay mobile, continue learning - Transfer class assignments from handheld to computer. Complete work outside of school using student software. On the desktop at home or a laptop on the bus, at the library, coffee shop or wherever. Explore higher-level math concepts - Explore symbolic algebra and symbolic calculus, in addition to standard numeric calculations. View exact values - in the form of variables such as x and y, radicals and pi - when doing step-by-step arithmetic, algebraic and calculus calculations.Visualize in full color - Color-code equations, objects, points and lines on the full-color, backlit display. Make faster, stronger connections between equations, graphs and geometric representations on screen. Real-world images - Use digital images or your own photos. Overlay and color-code math and science concepts. Discover real-world connections. Recharge with ease - The installed TI-Nspire Rechargeable Battery is expected to last up to two weeks of normal use on a single charge. No alkaline batteries needed. Calculate in style - The sleek TI-Nspire CX handheld is the thinnest and lightest TI graphing calculator model to date. It's also the brightest with a high-resolution, full-color display that makes it easy to see every exponent, variable and line. 3D Graphing - Graph and rotate (manually and automatically) 3D functions. Change the wire or surface color of your 3D graph.
feature_bullets: Ideal for Pre-Algebra, Algebra 1 & 2, Trigonometry, Geometry, Pre-calculus, Statistics, Business & Finance, Biology, Physics, Chemistry, Calculus, AP Statistics, AP Physics, AP Calculus, and Linear Algebra.
All the functionality of the TI-Nspire CX handheld plus a built-in Computer Algebra System (CAS)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,931 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
